comment: The inverse relation is a bijection from isomorphisms to isomorphisms. This means that every isomorphism ` F e. ( X I Y ) ` has a unique inverse, denoted by ` ( ( Inv `` C ) `` F ) ` . Remark 3.12 of [Adamek] p. 28. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Jan-2017.)
